definition: lease
to hire/to rent/to charter/to rent out/to lease out/rent/land tax
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: Could I have the lease translated before I sign it?
sentences.chinese: 在我籤租約之前能不能讓人先把它翻譯一下？

sentences.english: Several other international companies have also broken their leases, say property agents.
sentences.chinese: 據房產經濟介紹，其他幾個跨國公司也已撕毀租約。

sentences.english: Should the Vessel be prevented from China trading, Charterers to have the option of cancelling the Charter.
sentences.chinese: 如本船航行中因受阻，租船人有解除本租約的選擇權。

sentences.english: Landlords and tenants are bound by the lease and rules.
sentences.chinese: 房東和房客要互守租約和規條。

sentences.english: First,you will sign a preliminary rental agreement with the management office and pay the deposit.
sentences.chinese: 先與本公司籤一份臨時租約並交訂金。

sentences.english: Perhaps nobody signed leases at the Lorelei.
sentences.chinese: 也許，在羅雷萊沒有人籤租約。

sentences.english: The lease runs out next month.
This article discusses one clause in the Gencon C/P form which might appropriately be entitled "lien clause".
sentences.chinese: 主要討論金康租約及其他主要租約中的留置權條款。

sentences.english: This article discusses one clause in the Gencon C/P form which might appropriately be entitled "lien clause".
sentences.chinese: 主要討論金康租約及其他主要租約中的留置權條款。

sentences.english: That means if I sign a one-year lease, there will be no redecorating at all?
sentences.chinese: 就是說，如果我只籤一年租約，就不會重新裝修了？

sentences.english: She bought the house on a 99-year lease.
sentences.chinese: 她以九十九年的租約買下這種房子。

sentences.english: The tenant signed a one-year lease with the landlord.
sentences.chinese: 房客與房東簽了一年的租約。

sentences.english: Maybe it's a co-signed lease on a piece of property.
sentences.chinese: 也許是一份雙人簽名的房產租約。

sentences.english: That's a "Muppet. " It's all spelled out in your lease.
sentences.chinese: 那是“布偶”，它都明文寫在你的租約上。

sentences.english: The lease on Heather's apartment is up soon.
sentences.chinese: 而黑仁的租約快到期了。

sentences.english: Our funds had run out and our lease was up.
sentences.chinese: 我們的錢已用完，租約又到期了。

definition: tenant/person who leases
the end of fixed period in office/expiration of a term
property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
to hand in/to hand over
building
owner/proprietor
treaty/contract
to renew or extend a contract
stamp duty
running/operation (of airport, bus service, business etc)
to quote a price/seller's first offer
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
to adjust downwards/to lower (prices, wages etc)
to demote/to pass down to a lower unit
to reach agreement
to invite bids
a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
